intro: Manulea incisiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved manulea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small umbels, and it produces small, spherical berries. Manulea incisiflora is often found in forest understories and is adapted to humid, shaded environments.
